alert.note: Alert for Muscatine; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 28 at 8:52PM CDT until July 28 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT FOR EASTERN ROCK ISLAND...WHITESIDE...NORTHWESTERN HENRY...CARROLL... SOUTHERN JACKSON...SOUTHEASTERN CEDAR...SCOTT...NORTHEASTERN MUSCATINE AND CLINTON COUNTIES... At 851 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Springbrook to Grand Mound to near Wilton, moving east at 65 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS FOR PORTIONS OF EASTERN IOWA AND NORTHWEST ILLINOIS. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. Locations impacted include... Davenport, Moline, Rock Island, Bettendorf, Clinton, East Moline, Maquoketa, Morrison, Durant, Mount Carroll, Silvis, Geneseo, Eldridge, DeWitt, Milan, Colona, Camanche, Le Claire, Coal Valley and Savanna. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
